title: How to Make a Marshmallow Necklace

steps.headline: Arrange the marshmallows into bowls for ease of grabbing.
steps.description: If you have marshmallows in different colors and sizes, put them into different bowls, so that patterns can be made.

steps.headline: Lay a licorice lace on a cutting board or clean surface.
steps.description: Roll it out with the rolling pin to make it flat. It needs to be thin enough to thread through the needle's eye.

steps.headline: Thread the needle with the licorice lace.
steps.description: Push the needle and licorice lace through the center of the first marshmallow.

steps.headline: Thread the next one on.
steps.description: Keep the marshmallows close together onto the licorice lace, to allow you to fit lots on.

steps.headline: Continue to thread until there are lots of marshmallows forming the necklace.
steps.description: Don't thread right to the ends though, as there needs to be enough of the lace left to tie the knot.

steps.headline: Slip on the marshmallow necklace.
steps.description: Wear it for a while, then enjoy munching on it.

text: Arrange the marshmallows into bowls for ease of grabbing. If you have marshmallows in different colors and sizes, put them into different bowls, so that patterns can be made. Lay a licorice lace on a cutting board or clean surface. Roll it out with the rolling pin to make it flat. It needs to be thin enough to thread through the needle's eye. Thread the needle with the licorice lace. Push the needle and licorice lace through the center of the first marshmallow. Thread the next one on. Keep the marshmallows close together onto the licorice lace, to allow you to fit lots on. Continue to thread until there are lots of marshmallows forming the necklace. Don't thread right to the ends though, as there needs to be enough of the lace left to tie the knot. Knot the licorice thread together. The necklace is now formed. Slip on the marshmallow necklace. Wear it for a while, then enjoy munching on it.
